column2: title= The Invented Worlds of J.R.R. Tolkien: Drawings and Original Manuscripts from the Marquette University Collection
image=[[Image:The Invented Worlds of J.R.R. Tolkien.jpg
publisher=Haggerty Museum of Art Catalogues and Gallery Guides/Marquette University

column1: '''''The Invented Worlds of J.R.R. Tolkien: Drawings and Original Manuscripts from the Marquette University Collection''''' was first published in 2004 by [[Marquette University]] as the catalogue from the exhibition of the same name held at the Haggerty Museum of Art (October 21, 2004 - January 30, 2005).
*"Ways of WorldMaking: J.R.R. Tolkien" (Curtis L. Carter, p.7)
* "'A Masterpiece of the Future': A Brief History of Marquette's J.R.R. Tolkien Collection" ([[Matt Blessing]], p.17)
* Illustration - The first draft version of the first page of The Book of Mazarbul.
* Manuscript page - includes the first draft version of Thror’s Map.
* Manuscript page - includes the earliest sketch of the inscription and signs on the Doors of Durin.
* Manuscript page - The Ring Verse in Tolkien’s characteristic handwriting, and also in tengwar.
* Illustration - A page from Mr. Bliss - So he turned sharp to the right at the next turning, and ran straight into Mr.Day.
* Manuscript page - includes a plan of Minas Tirith, and a topographical plan of the city and the surrounding mountains.
* Illustration - A [[Letter to Father Francis Morgan
column2: code letter from Tolkien to Father Francis Morgan]].

column1: * Illustration - Cave paintings from The Father Christmas Letters.
* Manuscript page - A synoptic time scheme used while writing LotR.  It summarizes the movements of characters between the 13th and 17th of March.
